title: 0.1 GDY Schema
description: The schema for the Griddly Description YAML language (version 0.1)

Version.title: Version
Version.description: The version of the GDY yaml schema

Environment.title: Environment
Environment.description: Contains the definition of how the player interacts with the environment and how it is percieved by the players

TileSize.title: TileSize
TileSize.description: The common size of all the tiles in the environment. If tile images are supplied with different sizes to this, they will be scaled to this size

BackgroundTile.title: Background Tile
BackgroundTile.description: Filename of an the image that will be used as a background tile

Player.title: Player
Player.description: Defines how players (algorithms, agents, humans) interact with the environment.

Mode.title: Player Mode
Mode.description: The player mode defines how the Griddly engine will handle different players.

Actions.title: Action Configuration
Actions.description: Defines how the players (humans, algorithms, AI) will provide actions to the environment.

DirectControl.title: Direct Control
DirectControl.description: Direct all actions to a particular object in the environment.

Observer.title: Observer Configuration
Observer.description: Defines how the observations will be generated for the players in the game.

RotateWithAvatar.title: Rotate with avatar
RotateWithAvatar.description: The observer view will rotate to follow the orientation of the avatar.

TrackAvatar.title: Track Avatar
TrackAvatar.description: The observer view will track the position of the avatar.

OffsetX.title: OffsetX
OffsetX.description: X offset of the observer window.

OffsetY.title: OffsetY
OffsetY.description: Y offset of the observation window.

Variables.title: Global Variables
Variables.description: Definition global variables that can be access from any action.

items.title: Variable
items.description: Define a global variable such as number of items collected, actions performed etc.

InitialValue.title: Variable Initial Value
InitialValue.description: The initial value of the variable

Termination.title: Termination
Termination.description: Definition of the termination conditions of the environment.

Lose.title: Lose Conditions
Lose.description: If any of these conditions are met, the player associated with this condition will lose the game.

Win.title: Win Conditions
Win.description: If any of these conditions are met, the player associated with this condition will win the game.

terminationCondition.title: Termination Conditions
terminationCondition.description: When a termination condition is met, the game will reset itself. If there are multiple players, the termination arguments are expanded internally "per player". This can be used to find the first player to a certain number of objects, or the first player to reach a certain score

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: Check if the arguments are equal

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: Check if the first argument is greater than the second

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: Check if the first argument is less than the second

terminationArgument.description: An argument to the termination condition. If there are multiple players, then these arguments expand internally as "per player"
terminationArgument.title: Termination Arguments

oneOf.title: Object Count
oneOf.description: Returns the number of objects of the object name before the colon, for example ``flower:count`` or ``car:count``

oneOf.title: Max Steps
oneOf.description: Returns the number of game ticks that have passed

Levels.title: Game Level Maps
Levels.description: Level Strings which define the levels in the game environment.

Actions.title: Actions
Actions.description: Actions define all the game mechanics.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: The name given to an action such as "move" or "push".

Behaviours.title: Behaviours
Behaviours.description: The list of behaviours that define what happens to objects when actions are performed.

items.title: Behaviour Definition
items.description: Behaviour definitions are how Griddly builds the mechanics of environments. Behaviour definitions are made up of two components, the "source" behaviour and "destination" behaviour.

Src.title: Source
Src.description: Define the behaviour of the source object of an action.

Preconditions.title: Behaviour Preconditions
Preconditions.description: A list of checks that have to be performed before this action is executed.

Dst.title: Dest
Dst.description: Define the behaviour of the destination object of an action.

behaviourDefinitionObject.title: Behaviour Objects
behaviourDefinitionObject.description: The object or list of objects that this behaviour applies to.

oneOf.title: Single Object
oneOf.description: A single object the behaviour is applied to.

oneOf.title: List of Objects
oneOf.description: A list of object the behaviour is applied to

behaviourDefinitionPreconditionCommand.title: Behaviour Precondition
behaviourDefinitionPreconditionCommand.description: A check that must be performed before any action. This can be used to change the behaviour of objects based on their internal variables. For example checking whether an object has a key before opening a door.

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: Check if the arguments are equal

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: Check if the first argument is greater than the second

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: Check if the first argument is less than the second

behaviourDefinitionConditionalCommand.title: Conditional Behaviour Command
behaviourDefinitionConditionalCommand.description: A conditional command to run as part of an action behaviour.

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: The specified commands will only be run if the arguments are equal.

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is less than the second.

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is greater than the second.

behaviourDefinitionCommand.title: Behaviour Command
behaviourDefinitionCommand.description: A command to run as part of an action behaviour.

mov.description: Move the object to the location provided.
mov.title: Move

rot.title: Rotate
rot.description: Rotate the object to the direction supplied

cascade.title: Cascade Action
cascade.description: Repeat this action again in the same direction.

reward.title: Reward
reward.description: Increase the reward by the value specified. If the object is associated with a player, that player's reward is increased.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: Remove the object from the environment.

change_to.title: Change Object
change_to.description: Swaps this object for another one. (this does not preserve any properties of the current object)

destArgument.title: Destination
destArgument.description: The destination location of the action.

srcArgument.title: Source
srcArgument.description: The source location of the action.

commandArgumentList.title: Command Arguments
commandArgumentList.description: Arguments supplied to the commmand, can be integer values or variable names.

commandArgument.description: An argument to a behaviour command.
commandArgument.title: Command Argument

oneOf.title: Variable Name
oneOf.description: Any variables defined on the object can be used

Objects.title: Objects
Objects.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

items.title: Object Definition
items.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

Z.title: Z Index
Z.description: The Z index of an object

Name.title: Name
Name.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

MapCharacter.title: Map Character
MapCharacter.description: The character this object is represented by in the level mapping.

Variables.title: Variable Definitions
Variables.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

items.title: Variable
items.description: Define an object variable, such as health, items collected etc...

InitialValue.title: Variable Initial Value
InitialValue.description: The initial value of the variable

Observers.title: Observers configuration
Observers.description: Configure how the observers render the object

Sprite2D.title: Sprite2D Observer
Sprite2D.description: The Sprite2D render uses Vulkan to render the images to make the environment look super nice.

Image.description: Either a list of image tiles or a single image
Image.title: Sprite Image

oneOf.title: Single Image
oneOf.description: A single image to use for ever occurence of this object.

oneOf.title: Image Tiles
oneOf.description: A list of image tiles to combine for animations or walls.

items.title: Image Tile
items.description: A list of 2 or 16 tiles that make up the sprites for walls. Use in combination with TileMode.

Block2D.title: Block2D Observer
Block2D.description: The Sprite2D render uses Vulkan to render simple shapes.

Shape.title: Shape
Shape.description: The shape to use for this particular object

Scale.title: Scale
Scale.description: The scale of the shape. if 1.0 the shape will fill the grid location.
